[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The eProcurement system defines procurement workflow requirements for efficiency, compliance, and order processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: eProcurement optimizes purchasing, catalog management, and payment reconciliation while integrating with financial systems.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: eProcurement integrates with procurement platforms, accounting tools, and third-party reporting systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: eProcurement provides a web-based dashboard and CLI for monitoring procurement workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: eProcurement supports deployment on cloud and on-premise infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: eProcurement processes XML-based procurement data for structured data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: eProcurement ensures secure data transfer using encrypted channels.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: eProcurement optimizes transaction processing for high-volume procurement workloads.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: eProcurement ensures continuous operation with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: eProcurement adapts to public and private sector procurement environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: eProcurement integrates with external financial reporting and auditing platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: eProcurement manages catalog-based purchasing, order tracking, and financial reconciliation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for procurement managers, finance teams, and IT administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: eProcurement assumes compliance with e-GIF standards and availability of financial data sources.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Audit Trail: Transaction record for compliance.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall support XML-based data exchange with procurement tools.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall enable integration with third-party accounting platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall notify users of procurement order updates (REQ-USAB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage procurement catalogs with version control.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for tracking procurement activities.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall allow customization of procurement workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 100,000 transactions per day.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall validate procurement documents within 5 seconds (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall log all procurement transactions for audit purposes.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall comply with ACID properties for reliability.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support modular extensions for future scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 27001 standards for security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale to meet increasing workloads.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall provide detailed logs for debugging and compliance.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Verified through unit, integration, and performance tests.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and technical guides.
[SEC] 5. References: e-GIF standards, ISO 27001 guidelines, and XML schema documentation.
